bibl.title: The Fatimids and the Red Sea (969-1171).
Navigated Spaces, Connected Places. Proceedings of Red Sea Project V Held at the University of Exeter, 16-19 September 2010.

bibl.note: The Fatimids and the Red Sea: The time of ideology (969-1073). - The Red Sea: A major new stake for Fatimid policy (1073-1171). - Closer relations with trader community. - Direct military interventions. - The Fatimids and the beginning of the Kārim trade. - Conclusion.
bibl.seg: David Bramoullé, The Fatimids and the Red Sea (969-1171).

Dionisius A. Agius, John P. Cooper, Athena Trakadas & Chiara Zazzaro (edd.), Navigated Spaces, Connected Places. Proceedings of Red Sea Project V Held at the University of Exeter, 16-19 September 2010 = British Foundation for the Study of Arabia Monographs. 12 = BAR International Series. 2346 (Oxford, 2012) pp. 127-136, 1 carte.

The Fatimids and the Red Sea: The time of ideology (969-1073). - The Red Sea: A major new stake for Fatimid policy (1073-1171). - Closer relations with trader community. - Direct military interventions. - The Fatimids and the beginning of the Kārim trade. - Conclusion.
